answers.answer: Every pregnancy is different I didn't have Gd with my first but I did with my second things change and it doesn't matter how healthy you eat you can still develop it as it caused by the baby not being about to break down sugars in any food including natural sugars in healthy food developing Gd can put the baby at great risk and can even cause still birth and many abnormalities if not controlled I've already had one gtt test this pregnancy at 15 weeks and it was negative I'm having another at 28 weeks but like I already said every pregnancy is different and just coz I had it last year when I had my daughter doesn't mean I'll get it this time personally I wouldn't want to put my baby at risk even if I had never had it is still be tested I don't think any one should put there baby at risk of something that can be rather dangerous but that's only my personal opinion on the matter

Oh yes I've weighed the good and bad. I've even talked to my OB about it and she even thought it was a fluke the first go around with the GD. But if medical doctors are going to stop testing healthy women due to the test not being completely accurate, I think it's safe to assume that even the doctors are starting to regret testing healthy women. If you don't have it, great. Wonderful. But I choose not to get the test just like I choose to drink coffee and eat chocolate. I know what my body can handle and what it cannot handle. My normal blood sugar number is 65 so I do keep an eye on it but I refuse to starve myself this time around.

question: Anyone else going to refuse the glucose test during the 24-28 weeks? I had it with my first little girl without a lot of information and I've never had issues with blood sugar. My levels have always been normal at 50-80. They gave me the test over 24 hours of not eating with the first and, of course, my blood sugar was high by one point. My daughter and myself never had issues after birth and I've eaten only healthy foods with this pregnancy. I've also found out that the American medical society is also going to remove the test for anyone under the age of 25 as they aren't at a high risk with a normal pregnancy. I'm currently 20 so I'm not too worried this time around. I just want to know if there are any other women who are having a normal pregnancy and have no increased risk of diabetes who are refusing it as well?
